results.title: Citizen soldier
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description: An impression of the life throughout the year of a citizen soldier in the Citizens Military Forces. It delves into such aspects as how effective CMF training really is, why it is important to the individual and the country and what it offers to the soldier and to his employer.

results.title: Water skiing
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines basic courtesies and safety rules and procedures of the sport. Cast includes Bronwyn Wright, Robbie Woods. Commentary by Ken Warby.

results.title: Seamanship
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the three main factors that constitute good seamanship knowledge of the boat, one’s own limitations and correct weight distribution. Commentatory by Ken Warby. Cast includes Allan Robertson, Paul Coolahan, John Kelly, Barry Duncan.

results.title: Search and rescue
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Explains the ways in which search and rescue can be facilitated should the crew in distress observe certain basic procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer.

results.title: Australia at school
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows a range of schools from small country towns through to high schools in Sydney, grades from kindergarten to last year of high school. “A film outlining Australia’s system of primary and secondary education”. Cinematography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: In-shore waters
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines some basic navigational and safety rules small craft should be aware of when boating in waters used by commercial shipping. Cast: Alan Doggett, Bob Hicks.

results.title: Painting people
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Six Australian artists - William Dobell, Russell Drysdale, Clifton Pugh, William Dargie, Jan Molvig and Andrew Sibley - discuss the problems of portraiture, including paintings of Tom Roberts and Arthur Streeton.

results.title: Anokhi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The story of John and Faith Singh and their work in maintaining the traditional hand printed clothing “industry” of the villages around Jaipur.

results.title: Hospitals don't burn down
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A disturbingly realistic film about a fire in a high-rise hospital. It dramatically portrays the horror and awful consequences of such a tragedy. Demonstrates the results of good and bad training and the need for all personnel to learn basic drills and routines in case of fire. Cast includes Jeanne Drynan, Mark Edwards, Ray Marshall, Ralph Cotterill, Ken Goodlet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Peter Johnson and Film Australia

results.title: Paddington lace
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Paddington is one of Sydney’s oldest suburbs, which has developed somewhat along the lines of New York’s Greenwich Village or London’s Chelsea and has become Sydney’s artist colony. This is a fully dramatised film, which captures the essence of Paddington, not only by striking visuals of the Old-Sydney architecture in the area, but by re-enacting the mood and lifestyle of some typical, bohemian inhabitants. Scripted by Joan Long. Music by Grahame Bond and Rory O’Donaghue. Starring Ross Thompson, Janne Wesley and Ron Blanchard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris McCullough, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
